sections.title: Learning Objective 1
sections.content: By the end of this lesson, students will be able to write basic Python scripts to perform arithmetic operations and print outputs.

sections.title: Learning Objective 2
sections.content: Students will understand and apply variables, data types, and basic control structures in Python.

sections.title: Lesson Content
sections.content: Python is a high-level programming language known for its simplicity. To start, install Python from python.org. Use print('Hello, World!') to display text. Variables store data: x = 5. Data types include int, float, str. Loops like for i in range(5): print(i) repeat actions.

sections.title: Assessment
sections.content: Write a Python script that takes two numbers as input, adds them, and prints the result. Also, create a loop to print numbers from 1 to 10.
